components.name: location
components.title: Where will your activity take place?
components.hint: 'Sea' means any area which is submerged at mean high water spring tide and includes the waters of every estuary, river or channel where the tide flows at mean high water spring tide. Even waters in areas which are closed permanently or intermittently by a lock or other artificial means against the regular action of the tide are included, where seawater flows into or out from the area, either continuously or from time to time.

You indicated that your activity involved the laying of a cable, part of which would be located within 12NM and part outside of 12NM of the UK. Based on the information provided the activity requires a licence for the element to be located within 12NM. No exemption is available. Further it should be noted that a marine licence is required for the deposit of any associated cable protection both inside and beyond 12 NM.

Apply for a marine licence

items.text: On or under the sea bed

items.description: Including maintenance, alteration and improvement of existing works

items.text: Deposit of a substance or object
Removal of a substance or object

items.description: Any form of dredging whether or not involving the removal of material from the sea or sea bed. Please note: The disposal of dredged material is considered to be secondary 'deposit' activity. No exemptions are available for disposal of dredged material at sea.

items.text: Incineration of a substance or object
Sinking of a vessel or floating container
Maintenance of existing structures and assets
items.description: Maintenance means the upkeep or repair of an existing structure or asset within its existing 3 dimensional boundaries
flood defence and cables and pipeline inspection and repair

items.text: Coastal protection, drainage or flood defence
Emergency works in response to flood or imminent risk of a flood

To provide a aid to navigation
A harbour authority or someone on behalf of a harbour authority
A lighthouse authority or someone on behalf of a lighthouse authority
A harbour authority or someone on behalf of a harbour authority
A harbour authority or someone on behalf of a harbour authority

items.description: This type of cable transfers data from one place to another.
This type of cable allows the transfers of electricity from one place to another. This includes interconnector cables, which exchange electricity to and from continental Europe and beyond.
This type of cable exports electricity generated by an offshore wind farm or wave/tidal array to a substation on land.
cables supplying offshore structures, cables utilised in exploration or exploitation of natural resources and or pollution control etc.
